availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Willis D. Collins (Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Bourbon County, Kentucky, native. Son of Foster Collins and Elizabeth Matheny Collins. Married to Sally Ann Palmer Collins in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on October 2, 1834. Father of William L. Collins, Elizabeth Collins, and Lucinda J.H. Collins. Farmer in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Bourbon County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
